channel.title: Gloun Gun
channel.description:
I was playing around with the skill.cfg file for HL and I noticed that the Gluon Gun has 2 damage settings, a "narrow" and a "wide". The "narrow" does about half the damage of the "wide". So, what does this mean? Oh, and you can call me stupid, but I'm almost possitive that the pressing the sec. fire on the gluon gun while you were shooting locked the beem in place and you could move around with the beem still in the same place you pionted it at.
EDIT: Oh, GLUON gun, I typed gloun gun, how stupid of me. :stuck_out_tongue:

item.title: Gloun Gun
item.dc:creator: JamesKane
item.description:
The “Beam locking” is a bug where the fx was prevented from being destroyed.

The end point of the beam is computed only when the primary fire button is down. So, when you trigger the bug not only does the beam still show up but the end point does not update. Hence it looks like it is targeting something, but it is not.

Read full topic

item.title: Gloun Gun
item.dc:creator: Max_von_Bek
item.description:
bulbman:

By the way, I found multiple sources saying that the gluon gun had a sec. fire mode in which it sort of locked onto a target, although it may have only been in deathmatch.

It does that in SP as well - you have to fire the Gluon as you would normally, keep your finger on the trigger and then press and hold secondary fire as well. This does lock the beam in place and might have been useful for strafing whole rooms, but it doesn’t seem to work properly for whatever reason.

Try it now, but god mode is advisable if you indeed trying it out on a room full of Vorts.
